intro: Clarkia purpurea subsp. quadrivulnera, commonly known as the four-veined clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its four prominent veins on the leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
